revised_title: Vibrations of Thin Cylindrical Shells with Freely Supported Ends
tldr: This article investigates the flexural vibrations of thin cylindrical shells with freely supported ends, focusing on the natural frequencies and nodal patterns. The authors derive an expression for frequency using the strain relations of Timoshenko and the energy method, finding that three natural frequencies are associated with each nodal pattern. The study provides insights into the behavior of thin shells and has implications for engineering applications.
